entities

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.Body
      • city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
        • city.cs.engine.Walker
          • entities.Player

  • public class Player
extends city.cs.engine.Walker
    Represents the player character in the game, which is capable of multiple actions such as running, jumping, attacking, and special attacks. The player has health, lives, and can interact with the game world through various states and actions.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • setInputHandler

        public void setInputHandler(InputHandler newInputHandler)
        Sets the input handler for the player, allowing player actions to be controlled by external inputs.
        Parameters:
        newInputHandler - The input handler to process player inputs.

      • runRight

        public void runRight()
        Causes the player to run to the right, changing the player's visual representation to a running animation facing right.

      • runLeft

        public void runLeft()
        Causes the player to run to the left, changing the player's visual representation to a running animation facing left.

      • jumpRight

        public void jumpRight()
        Initiates the player's jump to the right, changing the player's visual representation to a jumping animation facing right and playing the jump sound effect.

      • jumpLeft

        public void jumpLeft()
        Initiates the player's jump to the left, changing the player's visual representation to a jumping animation facing left and playing the jump sound effect.

      • idleRight

        public void idleRight()
        Changes the player's visual representation to an idle stance facing right.

      • idleLeft

        public void idleLeft()
        Changes the player's visual representation to an idle stance facing left.

      • hurtLeft

        public void hurtLeft()
        Changes the player's visual representation to a hurt animation facing left and triggers the hurt sound effect.

      • hurtRight

        public void hurtRight()
        Changes the player's visual representation to a hurt animation facing right and triggers the hurt sound effect.

      • isFacingRight

        public boolean isFacingRight()
        Checks if the player is currently facing right.
        Returns:
        true if the player is facing right, false otherwise.

      • isInAir

        public boolean isInAir()
        Checks if the player is currently in the air, implying a jump or fall.
        Returns:
        true if the player is in the air, false otherwise.

        Ends the player's attack, removing the attack hitbox.

      • isAttacking

        public boolean isAttacking()
        Checks if the player is currently attacking.
        Returns:
        true if the player is in the process of attacking, false otherwise.

      • adjustGravity

        public void adjustGravity(float newGravityScale)
        Adjusts the player's gravity to the specified scale.
        Parameters:
        newGravityScale - The new gravity scale to be set for the player.

      • addFriction

        public void addFriction()
        Applies friction to the player to simulate realistic movement.

      • reduceHealth

        public void reduceHealth(int damageAmount)
        Reduces the player's health by a specified amount and plays a hurt sound, implementing a cooldown between damages.
        Parameters:
        damageAmount - The amount of health to be reduced from the player.

      • gainHealth

        public void gainHealth(int amount)
        Increases the player's health by a specified amount, not exceeding the maximum health.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of health to increase.

        public void endCrouch()

      • isVictorious

        public boolean isVictorious()
        Checks if the player has achieved a victorious state, indicating the completion of a level.
        Returns:
        true if the player is victorious, false otherwise.

      • setVictorious

        public void setVictorious(boolean victorious)
        Sets the player's victorious state. When set to true, it indicates that the player has completed the level. This state triggers a sound and transitions to new game levels, or a "YOU WIN" screen.
        Parameters:
        victorious - A boolean indicating whether the player has won (true) or not (false).
